Comments_List: I learned the basics of Spanish.
Entry level Spanish that I can use to communicate at the lowest level effectively.
Basic skills of Spanish
I learned a basic understand of Spanish, can make conversation a little bit.

By taking this course I have developed an abundance of knowledge about elementary spanish that I did not previously know. I have developed reading, writing, and talking skills in this language as well.
basic skills of how to speak Spanish and basic Spanish vocabulary that one could use in every day life
Learned the basics of speaking Spanish, grammar, vocab, etc.
Great course to gain the foundations of Spanish. I learned to work hard in this class.
To obtain basic Spanish conversational skills
Pace was a bit fast.

Strengths-very straightforward
Weaknesses-manageable
One strength of the course is how organized it is. Everything in the course packet is word for word and easy to follow. The professors are also very engaging and very easy to understand.
only go over one topic a day and moves very quickly
The course flows very well, it's a bit fast-paced but fair in general.
I felt this class was extremely solid.
Makes you learn Spanish well but I dont think the supersite is always the best learning tool
It's a fine class. Nothing special, but you'll definitely learn some spanish
Yes because Spanish is becoming a huge language today and what I learned in this course could be helpful to use in this day and age.
Yes, it is not too hard and it fufills a language

Yes I would recommend this course to anyone considering taking Spanish. Professor Garcia is great at explaining concepts. Make sure you do the homework every day so that you don't lose any points because she will check.

This course is a great way to learn a lot of information about a different language in a short amount of time. People who had no prior knowledge of the language will be able to walk out of the class able to have complete conversations.
yes it is good at teaching basic Spanish skills but moves quickly if you are a complete beginner
Yes, especially if they have taken a bit of Spanish before, or even if they have never taken Spanish.
I would.
I would recommend this course to another student, it was a very great base knowledge of spanish and the professor ensured that the students understood what was being taught.
